title: Cybersecurity Supply Chain Risk Management Practices
description: Supply chain risk management controls for federal information systems and organizations

controls.title: Policy and Procedures
controls.description: Develop, document, and disseminate supply chain risk management policy and procedures that address purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination, and compliance
assessment_criteria: SCRM policy exists and is approved

controls.title: Supply Chain Risk Management Plan
controls.description: Develop a plan for managing supply chain risks associated with the research, development, design, manufacturing, acquisition, delivery, integration, operations, maintenance, and disposal of systems, components, or services
assessment_criteria: SCRM plan exists for each system
Plan is reviewed and updated annually

controls.title: Supply Chain Controls and Processes
controls.description: Establish a process or processes to identify and address weaknesses or deficiencies in the supply chain elements and processes
assessment_criteria: Supply chain control processes are documented

controls.title: Provenance
controls.description: Document, monitor, and maintain valid provenance of systems, components, and associated data

controls.title: Acquisition Strategies, Tools, and Methods
controls.description: Employ acquisition strategies, contract tools, and procurement methods to protect against, detect, and mitigate supply chain risks

controls.title: Supplier Assessments and Reviews
controls.description: Assess and review the supply chain-related risks associated with suppliers or contractors and the system, system component, or system service they provide

controls.title: Supply Chain Operations Security
controls.description: Employ operations security controls to protect supply chain activities
assessment_criteria: OPSEC plan covers supply chain activities
Threat analysis conducted for supply chain

controls.title: Notification Agreements
controls.description: Establish agreements and procedures with entities involved in the supply chain for notification of supply chain compromises and results of assessments or audits

controls.title: Tamper Resistance and Detection
controls.description: Implement tamper protection for systems, system components, and associated data during development, manufacturing, and transportation

controls.title: Inspection of Systems or Components
controls.description: Inspect systems or system components upon delivery, at random, or at a specific state in the system development life cycle to detect tampering

controls.title: Component Authenticity
controls.description: Develop and implement anti-counterfeit policy and procedures that include the detection and prevention of counterfeit components

controls.title: Component Disposal
controls.description: Dispose of system components using organization-defined techniques and methods in accordance with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, policies, regulations, and standards
assessment_criteria: Chain of custody maintained during disposal

controls.title: Supply Chain Protection
controls.description: Protect against supply chain threats to the system, system component, or system service by employing security safeguards as part of a comprehensive, defense-in-depth information security strategy
assessment_criteria: Supply chain risk integrated into enterprise risk
Continuous monitoring of supply chain indicators

controls.title: Unsupported System Components
controls.description: Replace system components when support for the components is no longer available from the developer, vendor, or manufacturer; and provide options for alternative sources for continued support for unsupported components
assessment_criteria: Migration timeline defined for each EOL component

controls.title: Supply Chain Risk Management Strategy
controls.description: Develop an organization-wide strategy for managing supply chain risks associated with the development, acquisition, maintenance, and disposal of systems, system components, and system services
assessment_criteria: Strategy addresses all system lifecycle phases

controls.title: Acquisition Process
controls.description: Include security and supply chain risk management requirements, descriptions, and criteria in the acquisition contract for the system, system component, or system service
assessment_criteria: SCRM clauses in all vendor agreements

controls.title: External System Services
controls.description: Require that providers of external system services comply with organizational security requirements and employ defined controls in accordance with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, policies, regulations, standards, and guidance
